intro: Wangenheimia, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its flowers, which can be yellow or red, bloom in the evening and attract nocturnal pollinators like moths. Wangenheimia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
